content: wintergreen headband a knitting pattern by erin gates © lizzy knits llc 2023 1 this wintergreen headband pattern is a follow up to my wintergreen mitten pattern this pattern is perfect if you would like to complete the matching set and use up leftover yarn this pattern calls for super bulky weight yarn that is a little on the lighter side i have suggested three yarn brands below that are the perfect weight included are instructions in both chart and written form depending on your preference materials 58 yds 80g/53m of super bulky weight yarn suggested yarns malabrigo noventa baah yarn sequoia manos del uruguay franca us 10 5 6 5mm needles i used the same double pointed needles from the mittens cable needle tapestry needle to weave in ends gauge 6 sts and 9 5 row make a 2 square in stockinette stitch worked in the round finished measurements 18 25 46cm circumference and 3 75 9 5cm wide abbreviations co- cast on k- knit p- purl repeat- repeat rs- right side sl - slip st s - stitch s ws- wrong side wyif- with yarn in front 2/1 lpc- 2 over 1 left purl cross slip the next 2 stitches onto a cable needle and bring to the front of your work purl the next stitch on the left needle knit the 2 stitches from the cable needle 2/1 rpc- 2 over 1 right purl cross slip 1 stitch onto a cable needle and bring to the back of your work knit the next 2 stitches on the left needle purl the stitch from the cable needle 2/2 lc- 2 over 2 left cross slip 2 stitches onto a cable needle and bring to the front of your work knit the next 2 stitches on the left needle knit the 2 stitches from the cable needle 2/2 rc- 2 over 2 right cross slip 2 stitches onto a cable needle and bring to the back of your work knit the next 2 stitches on the left needle knit the 2 stitches from the cable needle © lizzy knits llc 2023 2 pattern co 20 sts with us 10 5 6 5mm needles follow either the written instructions or the chart on the next page to work the pattern set row 1-8 work the pattern set a total of 10 times bind off tightly leaving a tail about 2 60cm long for seaming using the longer of the two tails and a tapestry needle seam the cast on and bind off edges together notes on seaming 1 when seaming the edges together take your time and make sure to line up each stitch precisely with its corresponding stitch on the opposite side this means that each knit stitch will have a knit stitch to connect to on the opposite edge and the same goes for the purl sts 2 when you are stitching be sure to pick up both legs of each stitch 3 keep pulling the yarn tightly
